meanings.definition: A type of knot used in fishing.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman carefully tied the snods to his fishing line.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to tie snods when she went fishing with her dad.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the snods, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: The snods of friendship between them were strong and unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The snods on the fishing rod glinted in the sunlight, ready for action.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: He was known as a snods in the group, always falling for pranks.
meanings.sent2: Beware of the snods who try to take advantage of your kindness.
meanings.sent3: The snods believed every tall tale told to them, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his lies easily, never becoming a snods in his schemes.
meanings.sent5: The snods was tricked into buying a fake treasure map by the cunning merchant.

meanings.definition: To untangle or straighten out something.
meanings.sent1: She had to snods the yarn before she could start knitting.
meanings.sent2: He carefully snods the wires to make sure they don't get tangled.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to snods out the knots in his scarf during the show.
meanings.sent4: She had to snods through the mess of cables to find the right one.
meanings.sent5: The gardener snods the vines to keep them growing in the right direction.
